Posts.Content: Jun 22, 2011 12:22PM positive12 wrote: vickilf - sorry to hear you have to go through all this.  It is very hard to deal with all this information. This site has great information, it is overwhelming reading through all the posts, but it let's us know that we are not alone.  You have been through so much already, keep researching and good luck tomorrow. amandabu,beacon800,GoldenEyes  I have no idea why they asked for an MRI before a biopsy or without a consultation with the Dr.  I am starting to dislike my Dr., I wish they would have called me with more info.  I did find a Woman's Radiology center in Orlando and if I require additional tests, I will go see them.  Thank you so much for listening.
Posts.Title: MRI this week positive12 SarahsMom

Posts.Content: Jun 21, 2011 11:42AM positive12 wrote: Thank you for your kind words.  I have found comfort in this forum.  My MRI will be this Thursday June 23rd.  I called and requested copies of all my exams so far.  I will pick them up the same day I go in for the MRI.  The lady asked me if I wanted films or cd, I said cd.  Good thing you recommended the same thing  Thank you again for your support, I have learned so much from this site already.  Praying and staying positive.
Posts.Title: MRI this week positive12 SarahsMom

Posts.Content: Jun 21, 2011 04:10PM positive12 wrote: Maybe I am not asking the right questions from the office I went to get my mammo done, but they did not give me any birads score or what the results were.  I had to keep calling my Dr. office just to get some results on the 2nd mammo and US.  I am not considered high risk, that I know.  No BS cancer history in my family.  Thank you for the tips, I will take my ipod with me to keep me distracted.  My husband was traveling and decided to come home early to take me to the appt. So sweet! Have a great day ladies and let's try and stay positive!  My daughter's 14th B-Day is this weekend and I am staying busy planning her party.  Life does not stop, we have to keep going.
Posts.Title: MRI this week positive12 SarahsMom

Posts.Content: Jun 27, 2011 07:53AM positive12 wrote: Just like that, I got a call this morning that my MRI was clear and that there are no further test!  This has been an emotional journey and I am so glad I found this site to share my ups and downs with you ladies.  God bless you all as you go on with your own journey.  I will never be the same after this experience.  You are strong, courageous, mothers, daughters, sisters, friends, aunts, and so much more.  I admire you so much.
Posts.Title: MRI this week positive12 SarahsMom

Posts.Content: positive12 wrote: Hello ladies, So glad I found this site!  A little bit about myself, turned 40 this year and had my first mammogram May 20th.  Everything seemed normal.  I received a call June 6th that my mammo was little fuzzy and needed more pics.  I seriously thought that I moved during the mammo and they didn't get a good pic;)  Went in for a second mammo and US on the 13th.  The tech told me to wait for my doctor to call and I waited anxiously the whole week, until this past Friday June 17th, I get a call indicating that now I need an MRI!  Wow, what I thought was a fuzzy pic, is more serious.  Thanks to everyone for all the useful information, tomorrow I will stop by the Dr. Office and get copies of my exams so far.  I am still positive that everything will be ok.  If it was something more serious, they would have scheduled a biopsy already right?  Keep me in your prayers. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: MRI this week positive12 SarahsMom

Posts.Content: Jun 23, 2011 03:12PM positive12 wrote: MRI was done this morning.  It was a little loud, but not too uncomfortable.  I also got the written reports for the 1st and 2nd mammo and us.  I also walked into my Dr. office and asked to speak to him.  The receptionist was a little hesitant, but after I showed her the printout from the imaging center she went to the back and talked to the Dr.  He said he would see me right away.  My Dr. was great, he explained everything to me and also said he would call me as soon as the got the results.  They just called me and said the results didnot come in yet, but they would call me tomorrow as soon as they did.  I think I is important for your Dr. office to put a face to a name and not look at you just as another chart.  Praying everything will come back B9. Here are my results so far.  1st Mammo- There are two densities in the left breat.  One deep near the chest wall only partially imaged and one medially which is irregularly shaped.  It has a nodule with tail.  This measures approx. 8.0x12.0 mm.  There are no suspicious microcalcifications or distortion. BiRads Cat 0:Needs additional imaging and/or prior mammogram for comparison. Findings in the left breast require further evaluation with compression views and ultrasound. 2nd Mammo and US-There is a persistent flamed-shaped irregular density in the left breast far medially with slightly angular margins.  There is also a nodular area deep near the chest wall which is unclear whether or not it is a slip of pectoralis muscle. Birads Cat 0 Needs additional imaging and/or prior mammogram for comparison. Abnormailty in left breast is not fully characterized by mammograph and ultrasound.  MR evaluation is recommended.
